P101988.project_name: Jiangxi Shihutang Navigation and Hydropower Complex Project

keywords.cdata: adverse environmental impacts, Affordable Transport, air, air pollution, auditing, barge, barges, bottlenecks, bridge, canals, capacity building, capital investment, car, carbon emission, carbon emissions, civil service, civil works, clean renewable source, climate change, cubic meters, Dam, Dam crest, dam development, dam foundations, Dam Safety, Dam site, Dams, debt, demand for electricity, demand for power, dikes, downstream dams, drainage, drainage basin, emission, emission reductions, energy consumption, energy production, Environmental Assessment, Environmental Impact, Environmental Impact Assessment, environmental impacts, environmental problems, Environmental Protection, existing dam, Financial Management, financial risks, Financial transactions, financial viability, Flood Control, Flood Protection, foreign exchange, freight, freight traffic, freight transport, fuel, Funds Flow, gravity, gravity dam, greenhouse gas, greenhouse gas emissions, greenhouse gases, head, high energy, highway, highway capacity, highway expansion, highway projects, Highway safety, highways, hydrology, HYDROPOWER, hydropower generation, hydropower output, hydropower plant, indigenous People, Indigenous Peoples, inland transport, Inland Waterway, inland waterway network, Inland Waterway Transport, inland waterways, inspection, international ports, irrigation, land use, local government, local power, lower dam, million people, mitigation measures, mobility, modal transportation, Natural Habitats

project_abstract.cdata: The development objective of the Jiangxi Shihutang Navigation and Hydropower Complex Project for China is to improve utilization of the Gan River for more reliable freight transport and for cleaner energy production through: (a) improving inland waterway transport capacity and service levels for primary and secondary industries in the Nanchang-Ganzhou corridor of the Gan River; and (b) generating renewable electricity to help meet rapidly growing demand for energy in the region. There are three components to the project. The first component of the project is construction of Shihutang complex, which is a single integral infrastructure unit consisting of 23 sets of sluice gates, one grade third ship lock, one powerhouse of 120 MW installation capacity, and two sections of connection dam. The second component of the project is flood protection works, which consist of approximately 43km of dikes and 56km of diversion canals, about six sets of pumping stations, two sets of free drainage sluices and two sets of regulating sluices. The third and final component of the project is technical assistance (TA), which consists of two technical studies and a capacity building program which aim to build the institutional and technical capacities of the implementing agency.

P101988.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ZH</LangCode><ProjectName>江西石虎塘航电枢纽工程</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>本工程的建设目标是更多地利用赣江发展更可靠的货运，生产更清洁的水电。该目标将通过以下两项措施实现：（1）提升内河航运能力，提高为赣江南昌－赣州段第一第二产业服务的水平；（2）生产清洁可再生的水电，帮助满足该地区快速增长的电力需求。本项目设有三个子项目：（1）石虎塘枢纽工程建设子项目。石虎塘枢纽是单个综合性基础设施工程，由23组水闸、一个三级船闸、一座装机容量为12万千瓦的电厂以及两端连接坝组成；（2）防洪工程子项目。防洪工程包括约43公里堤坝、56公里引水渠、6组泵站、2组泄洪闸和2组节制闸；（3）技术援助子项目。本子项目包括两项技术研究和能力建设，其宗旨是建立实施机构的机构能力和技术能力。</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
